did.unittitle: Senior Vice President for Administration records

bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: Papers of the Vice President for Finance and Administration are grouped into four series: Administrative, Correspondence, Legal, and Reports. Administrative records include: financial forms; budgets and ledgers of expenditures; an inventory of the barn (destroyed by fire in 1916); information on insurance and risk management; proposals, contracts, payment schedules for the building of Stanford Hall, Kennedy Hall, and the science building; and receipts for taxes, water, and sewer connections. Correspondence dates from 1940 to 1971, and relates largely to properties, loan funds, utilities contracts, and financial aid. Legal records relate largely to estates, facilities, and insurance. Finally, the collection includes reports of Ford Foundation grants, annual planning, and blueprints of the Steam Plant. The collection also includes various printed materials, including handbooks for professional librarians, part-time employees, and retirement plan brochures. Volumes in the collection include: lists of students (1854-1855), student accounts and fees, college receipts and expenditures (1854-1856); student expenses (1850-1875); auditors reports (1936-1942); and other financial records.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
